programme.desc: Casa Roma: Gordon visits Casa Roma, the oldest restaurant in Lancaster, California. Although the bar is a success, the restaurant is failing and has had 20 chefs in two years.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Friendship Contraction: After Sheldon keeps him awake all night, an irate Leonard decides he needs to break the roommate agreement, which formally ends their friendship.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Vacation Solution: Sheldon helps Amy in her biology lab after he is forced to use up two weeks of holiday, but he is bored by the tasks that she gives him.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Rothman Disintegration: Sheldon and Kripke argue over who should get Professor Rothman's vacant corner office. Amy buys Penny some art to celebrate their friendship.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
programme.desc: (2014) Part-animated action-comedy with Megan Fox. Can four six-foot, super-powered mutant turtles that were once journalist April O'Neil's pets save New York from the Foot Clan?

programme.title: Home Alone 2: Lost in New York
programme.desc: (1992) Family comedy. Macaulay Culkin ends up in a swish New York hotel while his family are in Miami. But the burglars he defeated before (Joe Pesci and Daniel Stern) are back...

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mypods and Broomsticks: Homer suspects that Bart's new friend's Muslim family are terrorists. Meanwhile, Lisa becomes addicted to downloading songs on her new Mypod.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Burns and the Bees: Mr Burns wins a basketball team in a game of poker, then decides to build a stadium on top of Lisa's bee colony.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Brother's Little Helper: An experimental ADHD drug improves Bart's behaviour but makes him paranoid: is Major League Baseball using a satellite to read his thoughts?

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Guess Who's Coming to Criticize Dinner: Homer becomes a restaurant critic for the Springfield Shopper, and ends up so feared that the town's restaurateurs plot to kill him.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Treehouse of Horror X: Ned comes back to haunt the Simpsons after Marge accidentally runs him down, and Bart and Lisa get zapped by radiation and become superheroes.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: E-I-E-I-(Annoyed Grunt): The Simpsons are forced to flee to the countryside, where Homer accidentally invents highly addictive tomacco. But the animals like it too...

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Hello Gutter, Hello Fadder: Homer bowls a perfect 300 and becomes a celebrity, even appearing on the Springfield Squares with Bumblebee Man and his old nemesis Ron Howard.

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: This time the celebs watch Squid Game, Glastonbury, Open House: The Great Sex Experiment, Celebrity Bridge of Lies, Trainwreck: Poop Cruise and Millionaire Hoarders.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The Goggleboxers watch Michael McIntyre's The Wheel, Love Is Blind, Strictly Come Dancing, Boiling Point, HELP! My House Is Haunted, and All Creatures Great and Small.

programme.title: Memento
programme.desc: (2000) Christopher Nolan's Oscar-nominated thriller with Guy Pearce. A man tracking his wife's killer has no short-term memory so must find other ways to piece together the evidence.

programme.title: Django Unchained Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Quentin Tarantino and stars Samuel L Jackson, Christoph Waltz, Jamie Foxx and Kerry Washington talk about making the western adventure set against a backdrop of slavery.

programme.title: Patton
programme.desc: (1970) Multi-Oscar-winning, fact-based, Second World War drama starring George C Scott, who gives a vivid portrait of the famously straight-talking US commander General George Patton.

programme.title: Dead of Night
programme.desc: (1945) Five uncanny tales of the supernatural in one eerie package, the most famous starring ventriloquist Michael Redgrave and a deadly dummy. Prepare to be spooked.

programme.title: Django Unchained Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Quentin Tarantino and stars Samuel L Jackson, Christoph Waltz, Jamie Foxx and Kerry Washington talk about making the western adventure set against a backdrop of slavery.

programme.title: Groundhog Day
programme.desc: (1993) Harold Ramis's classic d√©j√†-vu comedy starring Bill Murray. A TV weatherman must relive the same day reporting on a clairvoyant groundhog until he learns to behave himself.

programme.title: Django Unchained Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Quentin Tarantino and stars Samuel L Jackson, Christoph Waltz, Jamie Foxx and Kerry Washington talk about making the western adventure set against a backdrop of slavery.

programme.title: Django Unchained
programme.desc: (2012) Quentin Tarantino's darkly comic, award-laden Western with Jamie Foxx, Christopher Waltz, Leonardo DiCaprio and Samuel L Jackson. A freed slave searches for his wife... and revenge.

programme.title: Fremont
programme.desc: (2023) Wryly amusing character-study drama with Anaita Wali Zada. A lonely Afghan refugee who writes fortunes for cookies decides to send a message to the world. With Jeremy Allen White.

programme.title: The Actors
programme.desc: (2003) Crime comedy caper starring Michael Caine and Dylan Moran. Two actors need to use all their thespian skills to stay alive when they con a retired gangster.

programme.title: The Sound Barrier
programme.desc: (1952) Drama starring Ralph Richardson as a pioneering aviator determined to break the sound barrier, even if it means risking the lives of those closest to him. Directed by David Lean.

programme.title: Against the Wind
programme.desc: (1948) Spy thriller. Robert Beatty, Simone Signoret, Jack Warner and Gordon Jackson star as British-trained saboteurs sent to Second World War Belgium. But one of them is a traitor...

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared
programme.desc: (1959) Satirical comedy starring Peter Sellers (in a triple role) and the original Doctor Who, William Hartnell. The world's smallest state, Grand Fenwick, declares war on the USA.

programme.title: The Fallen Idol
programme.desc: (1948) Adaptation of Graham Greene's story with Ralph Richardson and Bobby Henrey. A butler who is accused of murdering his wife, has only a schoolboy to fight his corner.

programme.title: The Personal History of David...
programme.desc: ...Copperfield Interview Special: Director Armando Iannucci and actor Dev Patel, who stars in the title role, talk about bringing Charles Dickens' beloved novel to the screen.

programme.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still
programme.desc: (2008) Remake of the sci-fi classic with Keanu Reeves. An alien visits Earth to tell humankind to stop destroying the planet. But when he's attacked, he decides to eradicate us instead...

programme.title: Free Guy
programme.desc: (2021) Comedy action starring Ryan Reynolds. Guy lives in Free City. Free City isn't real. Nor is Guy. It's all a big online game. Can he take down the corrupt game publisher?

programme.title: Overlord
programme.desc: (2018) World War II horror produced by JJ Abrams, with Jovan Adepo. American soldiers parachute into occupied France, where they're confronted by the horrific results of Nazi experiments.

programme.title: Flag Day
programme.desc: (2021) Crime drama based on a true story, directed by and starring Sean Penn as a talented counterfeiter who's not so good as a father. Features Penn's real-life kids Dylan and Hopper Jack.

programme.title: The Personal History of David...
programme.desc: ...Copperfield Interview Special: Director Armando Iannucci and actor Dev Patel, who stars in the title role, talk about bringing Charles Dickens' beloved novel to the screen.

programme.title: Babe

programme.title: The Electrical Life of Louis...
programme.desc: ...Wain Interview Special: Stars Benedict Cumberbatch and Claire Foy talk about making director Will Sharpe's eccentric biopic of artist and inventor Louis Wain.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a ¬£10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Graham, Derry, Elizabeth and Ben pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Emmerdale

programme.title: Scotland Tonight: Fighting Parkinson's
programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: I Fought the Law: The Ann Ming Story
programme.desc: How Ann Ming, the grieving mother of Julie Hogg who was murdered in 1989, fought for 17 years to change the 800-year-old double jeopardy law to ensure her daughter's killer was brought to justice. Plus, how her fight paved the way for other landmark convictions including Stephen Lawrence's killers. Narrated by Sheridan Smith

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Toxic Legacy: Our Hidden Drug Scandal - Tonight
programme.desc: Social affairs correspondent Sarah Corker investigates the scandal surrounding the prescription of synthetic hormone DES to pregnant women that led to life-altering health problems for some of their children including infertility and rare cancers. She meets the women who say more must be done to help those exposed to the drug as new concerns emerge over the impact of DES on a third generation

programme.title: Stonehouse
programme.desc: John draws suspicion from local police while hiding out in Melbourne, while Barbara and Sheila fly to Australia to confront the disappeared MP. Fact-based drama about ambitious British politician John Stonehouse, starring Matthew Macfadyen and Keeley Hawes

programme.title: Genius Game
programme.desc: With the first person having been eliminated, only 10 players return for the Main Match of Zombie Game. The contestants who are designated zombies have to turn the ones who are humans into zombies, while their opponent must avoid being turned. Who will navigate their way through the apocalypse and be triumphant, and who will be sent home in the Death Match? Game show, hosted by David Tennant

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: The hosts are joined by Yvette Fielding, with Shivi Ramoutar serving up rosti with a fried egg for breakfast, while Jimmy Doherty gives the tapirs belly rubs at the wildlife park. programme.title: Stonehouse
programme.desc: With Wilson's fate still on a knife edge and Barbara wondering if it's worth saving her marriage, John and Sheila go on trial to face the consequences of their actions. Fact-based drama about ambitious British politician John Stonehouse, starring Matthew Macfadyen

programme.title: One Night
programme.desc: As One Night's success continues to grow, fractures among the three friends deepen. Simone witnesses Eden become the voice and face of her book online and in the media. Fed up with her book being 'stolen', Simone hatches a plan to put her name on the book. Hat fights to have it removed from shelves and Tess devises a revenge plan against the Calleys. Thriller, starring Nicole da Silva, Jodie Whittaker and Jillian Nguyen

programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.desc: Katie is joined by TV presenter Jake Humphrey, while Michael Douglas and Genevieve Turley transform a woman who has fostered more than 50 children. Jack Kinsey teaches Katie and Aldo Zilli about tablescaping

programme.desc: Raymond shares a collection of recipes using wine, cooking braised beef in red wine and a summer fruit soup, while fellow chef Michael Caines prepares pan-fried turbot with roasted leeks, red wine sauce and parsley oil

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Alan Davies joins the presenters as Shivi Ramoutar makes halloumi and hot honey crumpets, and Jimmy Doherty whips up frozen treats for the animals at the wildlife park. Plus, gardener Chantal chats about composting and Shivi visits a local distillery to make gin for Alan's cocktail

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure starring Daniel Radcliffe. Harry Potter lives a miserable existence with his loathsome aunt and uncle. Harry is offered a place at the prestigious Hogwarts boarding school for wizards and soon embarks on a new life filled with magic and mystery.

programme.title: Win Win
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins host the interactive quiz show in which viewers get the chance to win the same prizes as the contestants playing in the studio. programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show as it travels around the UK to find ordinary people taking on extraordinary challenges for the chance to win ¬£5,000

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: One Night
programme.desc: Fearing Trevor Calley, Hat begins her own investigation into the events of the past. As she digs deeper, it becomes clear the police are hiding something. Anxious about the repercussions of the book, Hat refuses to withdraw her legal action against Simone and the publishers of One Night

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the latest fixtures, including Oxford United v Leicester City at Kassam Stadium, Preston North End v Middlesbrough at Deepdale and Stoke City v Birmingham City at bet365 Stadium in the Championship

programme.title: Stonehouse
programme.desc: The 1970 election proves to be a turning point for Labour MP John Stonehouse when his party loses power and he goes from flag-waver to scapegoat, and is left out in the cold by deposed prime minister Harold Wilson, Czech spymaster Alexander Marek and the media. Rumours of fraud are circulating too, as his suspect investments are scrutinised and he ends up hatching an outlandish plan to escape his troubles. Fact-based drama, starring Matthew Macfadyen and Keeley Hawes

programme.title: How to Keep Your Money Safe? - Tonight
programme.desc: More than six million people in the UK say they have low confidence when it comes to managing their money, while 26 million are considered financially vulnerable. What can we do to protect ourselves and keep cash safe? Ruth Dodsworth, who experienced devastating financial loss, has been finding out

programme.title: The Dry
programme.desc: Shiv flirts with a barista while celebrating her 36th birthday, but remains determined not to let a man derail her sobriety again and refuses his offer of a date. Meanwhile, Bernie has a new boyfriend and is being lauded for laying off alcohol, much to Shiv's annoyance. Return of the comedy drama, starring Roisin Gallagher

Plus, how her fight paved the way for other landmark convictions including Stephen Lawrence's killers. Narrated by Sheridan Smith

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Toxic Legacy: Our Hidden Drug Scandal - Tonight
programme.desc: Social affairs correspondent Sarah Corker investigates the scandal surrounding the prescription of synthetic hormone DES to pregnant women that led to life-altering health problems for some of their children including infertility and rare cancers. She meets the women who say more must be done to help those exposed to the drug as new concerns emerge over the impact of DES on a third generation

programme.title: Stonehouse
programme.desc: John draws suspicion from local police while hiding out in Melbourne, while Barbara and Sheila fly to Australia to confront the disappeared MP. Fact-based drama about ambitious British politician John Stonehouse, starring Matthew Macfadyen and Keeley Hawes

programme.title: Genius Game
programme.desc: With the first person having been eliminated, only 10 players return for the Main Match of Zombie Game. The contestants who are designated zombies have to turn the ones who are humans into zombies, while their opponent must avoid being turned. Who will navigate their way through the apocalypse and be triumphant, and who will be sent home in the Death Match? Game show, hosted by David Tennant

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
